header.title: wxScrollWinEvent

description.p: A scroll event holds information about events sent from scrolling windows.
Note that you can use the EVT_SCROLLWIN* macros for intercepting scroll window events from the receiving window.
This class is derived (and can use functions) from: wxEvent

section.title: Events
section.p: Use wxEvtHandler:connect/3 with wxScrollWinEventType to subscribe to events of this type.

func.fsummary: Returns wxHORIZONTAL or wxVERTICAL, depending on the orientation of the scrollbar.

desc.p: Returns wxHORIZONTAL or wxVERTICAL, depending on the orientation of the scrollbar.

func.fsummary: Returns the position of the scrollbar for the thumb track and release events.

desc.p: Returns the position of the scrollbar for the thumb track and release events.
Note that this field can't be used for the other events, you need to query the window itself for the current position in that case.
